channel.title: My first time using SCAR, probably dumb questions
channel.description: I would just like to know a few things. In my auto alcher I was wondering if it is possible to randomly select coordinates from like 750-760, 450-460 (Not the real numbers just an example) so it is less detictable. Also I do not know how anti randoms work. Sorry if these questions have been anwsered but I am kind of new to scar.

item.title: My first time using SCAR, probably dumb questions
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Sub Zero:

I thought it was FindNormalRandoms; ;D

It is

And if you are scripting for runescape, I suggest using Mouse(x,y,random x,random y : integer; left:boolean); ClickMouse
and MMouse(x, y, random x, random y : integer); //MoveMouse

They are way less detectable.

Read full topic
item.source: My first time using SCAR, probably dumb questions

item.title: My first time using SCAR, probably dumb questions
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

of course.

ClickMouse(750+Random(10), 450+Random(10));

For antirandoms, just include the SRL antirandoms, and I think the procedure isâ€¦

FindNormalAntiRandoms;

Read full topic
